newsitem.title: UK: UK's Scott Pickford says gets approach.
newsitem.headline: UK's Scott Pickford says gets approach.

text.p: British engineering and geoscience firm Scott Pickford Plc said on Friday it had received an approach from an undisclosed party that may lead to an offer for the company.
The firm said an offer, if made, would likely be at a price of about 53p per share.
That price would compare to the offer of 48p per share that may be made under a previously-announced deal with Australia's Aerodata Holdings Ltd, the company said in a statement.
Last month, Scott Pickford said Aerodata planned to buy 2.5 million of its 10p shares at 48p each, giving it a 20 percent stake in its share capital.
Scott Pickford, in turn, would be offered 1.873 million shares in Aerodata at A$0.50 each, amounting to 4.3 percent of Aerodata's share capital.
Aerodata provides airborne geophysical data and related services for mineral and oil exploration.
Scott Pickford's shares were unchanged at 44.5p at 0750 GMT.
